name: The Society of Orpheus and Bacchus
description: '''The Society of Orpheus and Bacchus''', also known as the '''SOBs''', is an  ''[[a cappella]]'' singing group from [[Yale University]]. Founded in 1938, The Society of Orpheus and Bacchus is the second longest continuously running underclassmen a{{nbsp}}cappella group in the United States. Alumni of the SOBs have gone on to be founding members of other college ''a cappella'' groups such as The Pitchforks of Duke University (Jeff Warren 1978) and The Chorallaries of MIT (David H. Bass 1975, also composer of their [[Godiva's Hymn|Engineer's Drinking Song]]).
